title: Richardson dislocates pinkie on big sack, exits
content: Colts quarterback Anthony Richardson Sr. dislocated the pinkie on his right, throwing hand in the first quarter of Thursday night's preseason-opening 24-16 loss to the Ravens and did not return.

title: Texans' Ward arrested in relation to June case
content: Texans safety Jimmie Ward was arrested Thursday because he tested positive for alcohol in violation of the terms of his bail, his lawyer told KPRC 2.

title: Crypto group says it orchestrated sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: Thomas makes WNBA history with triple-double
content: Alyssa Thomas had 18 points, 11 rebounds and 10 assists to become the first WNBA player with three straight triple-doubles in Phoenix's 95-60 win over Indiana on Thursday night.

title: Skenes allows career-worst 7 hits, still blanks Reds
content: Pirates ace Paul Skenes' record streak of allowing six or fewer hits ended at 46 starts on Thursday night in a 7-0 win over the Reds.

title: Chargers' Slater done for year with patellar tear
content: Star Chargers left tackle Rashawn Slater suffered a season-ending ruptured patellar tendon in practice Thursday, the team said.

title: Mboko, 18, caps Montreal run with 1st WTA title
content: Canadian teen Victoria Mboko rallied to defeat four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka 2-6, 6-4, 6-1 and win the National Bank Open title Thursday night.

title: Ravens rookie CB suffers gruesome knee injury
content: Ravens rookie cornerback Bilhal Kone had his left leg put in an air cast and was carted off after a gruesome knee injury in the preseason opener vs. the Colts.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in summer drafts.

title: Does NFL success and fame translate to college success? These schools are betting it does
content: With high expectations for this new wave of celebrity coaches, reputation can take these leaders only so far.

content: After a trade deadline that was more mild than wild, we asked around the sport to see if the Cubs have enough to win big.

title: Caitlin Clark and 13 more impact WNBA players for playoff (or future) success
content: The margin for error is shrinking as the playoffs approach. Who will be the difference-makers for their teams?

content: Which schools have the best talent for next year's draft? We picked 12 must-watch rosters loaded with potential future first-rounders.

title: 'I'm made for it': Austin Simmons gets his shot at Ole Miss
content: At 19, the two-sport star has already graduated from Ole Miss, but he's getting his first chance to start at QB.

title: Can Wrexham's Hollywood fairy tale continue in Championship, or is rude awakening ahead?
content: Celebrity owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac said Wrexham will reach the Premier League -- but the closer they get, the more unrealistic it is.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs, Bayern, Newcastle in race for Chelsea's Jackson
content: Tottenham Hotspur and Bayern Munich are poised to make a move for Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: When will Cooper Flagg be an All-Star? Projecting the No. 1 pick's NBA future
content: How many MVPs and titles for Cooper Flagg? When can Dallas expect success with him? ESPN experts predict his NBA future.

title: 'Raw end of the stick': Taurasi opens up on being benched for Olympic gold medal game in new documentary
content: A new docuseries sheds light on key parts of the retired star's WNBA, Olympic and overseas basketball career.

title: How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 running backs in Madden NFL 26
content: Jahmyr Gibbs, Christian McCaffrey and others are near the top of Madden NFL 26's running back rankings.

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Dolidze vs. Hernandez
content: MMA expert Din Thomas picks Dolidze vs. Hernandez and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Week 11 preview: What's at stake in the final regular-season weekend?
content: The PLL heads to Boston, with three playoff spots open. Here's the game schedule, clinching scenarios, more.

content: With players focusing on the looming European club season, nine months remain before World Cup squads are announced. Who will be on the U.S.'s?

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

content: A lot of teams made strong postseason pushes at the MLB trade deadline. What are you going to do with your team as the fantasy trade deadline approaches?

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: New society will be formed with coir corporation trainees, says Rajeeve
content: A newly formed group of trainees been given an order worth ₹50 lakh. Three-hundred people have been trained in 6 batches

title: Cabinet approves construction of 4-lane Marakkanam–Puducherry (NH-332A) on HAM mode
content: The project, that will be part of the Chennai–Puducherry–Nagapattinam-Tuticorin-Kanyakumari Economic Corridor, will be developed on hybrid annuity mode (HAM) at a total capital cost of ₹2,157 crore

title: 'Vote theft' claim: Congress stages 'rasta roko' in Mumbai; EC has lost credibility, says Sapkal
content: Congress leaders and workers, led by the party's Maharashtra unit chief Harshwardhan Sapkal, blocked traffic and raised slogans against the EC and the BJP government, causing a traffic snarl that lasted for over an hour

title: Minor traffic disruptions reported in Bengaluru during Rahul Gandhi’s visit
content: Bylanes across HAL and Indiranagar saw traffic snarls as a result of parking restrictions and vehicle movement limitations enforced by the Bengaluru Traffic Police

title: China welcomes PM Modi's planned visit to attend SCO Summit
content: The Foreign Ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said that leaders of over 20 countries, including all member states of the SCO and heads of 10 international organisations, will attend relevant events

title: Govt. to pursue NOC from Chhattisgarh for Sammakka Barrage: Minister
content: An expert team assessing Singur dam safety, says Uttam Kumar Reddy and asks engineers to focus on temporary measures first

title: Ministry of Defence denies reports of pausing defence purchases with U.S.
content: Reuters  exclusive report had claimed that India had put on hold its plans to procure new U.S. weapons and aircraft

title: Actor Vinayakan’s social media post draws criticism
content: Vinayakan had criticised filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan for his statement made at a recently held film conclave. He also dragged singer Yesudas into the controversy using an expletive-laden social media post

title: India pauses plans to buy U.S. arms after Donald Trump’s tariffs, Reuters reports
content: The U.S. President imposed an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods as punishment for Delhi's purchases of Russian oil, which he said meant the country was funding Russia's invasion of Ukraine. That raised the total duty on Indian exports to 50% — among the highest of any U.S. trading partner

title: ‘Sangarsha Ghadana’ movie review: Krishand’s rumination on the futility of war brims with quiet inventiveness
content: With a distinct visual and narrative style, Krishand takes a less trodden path to deliver a philosophical rumination on the futility of war

title: Onam Khadi fair opens in Alappuzha
content: Promoting the message ‘I too want Khadi’, a wide collection of diverse cotton, silk, and linen khadi garments, along with attractive gift schemes, has been arranged in khadi sales outlets as part of Onam celebrations

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: 65 families who lost kin hire U.S.-based law firm Beasley Allen
content: The law firm's aviation attorney Mike Andrews visited the crash site in Meghaninagar area in Ahmedabad before coming to Vadodara city, where he met some of the victim families

title: Malviya tempers stand on Sylheti speakers after criticism
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party leader has been criticised by Sylheti speakers in Assam after defending the Delhi police’s ‘Bangladeshi language’ note

title: Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College controversy gets murkier
content: On the first examination of Haris Chirackal’s room, a small box with a Morcellator was found. On a “detailed” examination of the room on the second day, a bigger carton, which seemed to have come through a courier service, containing a Nephroscope was found. Few bills were found inside the box, which seemed “unusual,” for one of the bills  seemed to have been issued on August 2 by some company in Ernakulam for the purchase of a Morcellator, says medical college authorities

title: Mysuru Dasara Illumination to be more attractive and innovative this year as people’s expectations have gone up: CESC MD
content: CESC MD tells electrical contractors, who are vested with the responsibility of illuminating the streets and the circles, to focus on innovation

title: CBSE chief Rahul Singh gets two year extension
content: Rahul Singh, a 1996-batch Indian Administrative Service officer of the Bihar cadre, was appointed to the post on March 13 last year

title: Cabinet approves ₹30,000 crore as compensation to OMCs for losses in domestic LPG
content: PMUY was launched in May 2016, to provide free LPG connection to adult women from poor households across the country. As on July 1, there are about 10.33 crore PMUY connections in India

title: Mann ki Baat earns ₹34.13 crore since inception: Centre
content: Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting L Murugan said the Mann ki Baat programme reaches the audience through multiple traditional and digital platforms

title: Andhra Pradesh launches 72-hour fast-track clearance for high-rise building permissions
content: Under the SOP, a special cell has been set up at the DTCP office in Mangalagiri to exclusively handle high-rise applications

title: Nirmala Sitharaman withdraws Income Tax Bill in Lok Sabha; new Bill to be introduced on August 11
content: The updated version of the Income Tax Bill, according to sources, will incorporate most of the recommendations of the Select Committee

title: A.P. Congress chief Y.S. Sharmila demands reinstallation of YSR’s statue at Nandigama centre
content: Asserting that YSR did not have anything to do with YSR Congress Party, Y. S. Sharmila said her father was a staunch Congress leader, who, as the Chief Minister of the undivided Andhra Pradesh, worked relentlessly for the welfare of the people at the grassroot level

title: BJP reconstitutes party core committee ahead of local body polls in Kerala
content: A party insider says focus is on inducting young blood, ensuring caste, community, and minority representation, to re-energise leadership to establish better community relations

title: Rahul Gandhi slams ECI for asking affidavit under oath, says he has taken oath in Parliament
content: The Congress leader claimed that such new votes went to the BJP, which pointed to "wrongdoings." Wherever such new voters cast their votes, the BJP won

title: Kerala Chief Minister asks Union government to preserve BrahMos Aerospace
content: Kerala Chief Minister  Pinarayi Vijayan expresses concern over Centre’s plan to merge BrahMos Aerospace Thiruvananthapuram Limited with the parent company, BrahMos Aerospace Private Limited

title: Madras HC Division Bench stays single judge’s order favouring allotment of Kalaignarin Kanavu Illam houses to Tamil writers
content: Justices J. Nisha Banu and M. Jothiraman grant the interim stay pursuant to a writ appeal filed by the State government

title: ‘Memory card’ controversy rocks Malayalam actors’ body AMMA ahead of election
content: Row over missing memory card from 2018 AMMA women’s meet amid fears of its leak. Women members file petitions and counter petitions

title: DMK general secretary Duraimurugan questions Palaniswami’s ‘silence’ over SIR row
content: He further alleged that the BJP-led Union government might attempt to indiscriminately add lakhs of people from other States to the Tamil Nadu voter rolls, which amounts to taking away the State’s political rights

title: Amit Shah lays foundation stone for Janaki Mandir’s redevelopment in Bihar’s Sitamarhi
content: The Bihar Cabinet had on July 1, 2025 sanctioned ₹882.87 crore for the integrated development of the temple complex

title: Union Minister Sanjay Kumar demands Telangana Government to hand over phone tapping case probe to CBI
content: Speaking to reporters before meeting the officers of the Special Investigation Team to record his statement as a witness in the phone tapping case, he said he does not have “trust” in the probe by the SIT

title: Konaseema’s craftswomen set to roar online with lion faces made of coir fibre
content: Groomed by the Ministry of Textiles, a group of 30 craftswomen of Janupalle panchayat have come up with 25 products with coconut coir fibre

title: Operation ‘Secure Land’ helps Vigilance unearth entrenched corruption at sub-registrar offices in Kerala
content: VACB, which conducted surprise checks at 72 sub-registrar offices across Kerala, claims it found that a corrupt nexus coerced citizens to pay sizeable backhanders for availing themselves of basic and critical services

title: Madras High Court permits Senthilbalaji’s brother Ashok Kumar to visit US for medical treatment
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan grant the permission but impose various conditions, including the surrender of his daughter’s passport before a sessions court

title: Unhappy over probe, R.G. Kar victim's parents meet CBI director; assured all assistance
content: From day one, we have said there was more than one person. She was a strong girl. There is no way only one man could have done this inside such a secure building, says the victim's mother

title: Supreme Court proposes interim committee to manage Bankey Bihari temple
content: The court told the parties that it would also keep in abeyance a provision mandating the constitution of a committee or trust to manage the temple

title: Rahul Gandhi asks Karnataka government to investigate ‘vote fraud’ in Mahadevapura Assembly constituency
content: Mr. Gandhi claimed that 1,00,250 “fake votes” were created in Mahadevapura in order to ensure a win for the BJP during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections

title: Kerala seeks assurances from Centre on combating U.S. tariffs
content: Balagopal criticises Modi government for striking critical trade deals with foreign nations, including recent one with U.K., without consultations with States and discussions in Parliament

title: Two CRPF jawans injured in IED blast in Jharkhand
content: The incident occurred around noon in the Mankey area near Jaraikela in Saranda forest, one of Asia's thickest forests, when the CRPF personnel were conducting a search operation, an officer said.

title: Punitive U.S. tariffs could cause Kerala economy to regress into COVID-19 era, says State Finance Minister
content: Calling it ‘tariff bullying’, K.N. Balagopal says high tariffs will hit Kerala’s seafood, spices, agriculture and coir sectors hard

content: The court underlined that various issues raised by Michel, including his release, have already been considered by the Supreme Court, Delhi High Court and the present court.

content: Deputy Chairman Harivansh informed the house that 56 hours and 49 minutes of Parliamentary time was wasted in the protests

content: RE walls had caved in, and cracks appeared in many stretches of the road, giving rise to safety concerns and traffic snarls

title: Plea in SC says BNS has ‘repackaged’ colonial sedition law; Bench seeks Centre’s reply

title: ECI asking Rahul Gandhi to submit complaint on Karnataka roll manipulation under oath infructuous in this situation: experts
content: According to Constitution Law expert P.D.T. Achary, “These rules do not apply in this situation and these rules apply till 30 days after draft rolls are published”

title: CM Stalin releases Tamil Nadu’s State policy for school education; reiterates two-language formula
content: The policy has been designed in view of Tamil Nadu’s unique character and is aimed at preparing students for the future with a vision, Mr. Stalin said

title: Reliance Infra to recover $2.44 billion in unpaid power dues from Delhi consumers
content: The Delhi Electricity Regulatory Commission will oversee the recovery process, which is expected to result in increased electricity bills for consumers in Delhi.

title: SIR 'institutionalised chori'; ECI colluding with BJP to carry out 'vote theft': Rahul
content: We have caught just one method, we have not probed other methods. I am telling the EC and its officials clearly that what you are doing is not right. This is treason against the country, says Congress leader  Rahul Gandhi

title: Silent killer in paradise village: Chronic kidney disorders in Andhra Pradesh’s Bhadrayyapeta
content: An alarming number of residents suffer from chronic kidney disorders in a sleepy little village near Visakhapatnam city. Almost every household has at least one member battling a renal issue. The residents blame the water supplied through the sole community tap in the village while officials point out shortcomings in cleanliness and improper medication, reports Harish Gilai

title: Casinos to crypto: how cybercriminals launder money
content: Recovering money swindled from victims in cyber crimes is already a herculean task. The Hindu reports on the recent trends which show how cyber criminal networks are colluding with other networks like casinos, online betting apps and crypto currency exchanges to launder money, complicating the money trail.

content: It is concerning that more women have been deleted from the rolls, given that men out-migrate more from the State

title: India Pauses Plans To Buy US Weapons, Aircraft After Trump Tariffs: Report
content: The Defence Ministry has denied news reports claiming that India plans to pause its arms purchases from the United States after US President Donald Trump announced an additional 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods.

title: "US Dollars Not Fuelling Russian War Machine?" Shashi Tharoor Exclusive
content: US President Donald Trump's "double standards" should be countered head-on and India must not let anybody dictate terms to it, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor told NDTV in an exclusive interview today.

title: 556 People Rescued In Uttarkashi, Army Builds Bridge Over River To Hasten Evacuation
content: Sniffer dogs nosed their way through rubble, drones circled overhead and rescue personnel searched for the missing in Dharali, days since raging waters buried half the village.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why India Is Bound To Emerge Stronger From The Tariff Chaos
content: The resilience of India's economy is a cornerstone of its ability to weather these tariff pressures with minimal disruption.

title: At Least 10 Killed, 33 Missing In Flash Floods In China
content: Ten people are dead and 33 missing after flash floods and mudslides in northwest China's Gansu province, state media reported Friday, the latest in a series of lethal weather events to hit the country.

title: Hamas Says Israeli Takeover Of Gaza City "Means Sacrificing" Hostages
content: Hamas warned the Israeli government on Friday that seizing control of Gaza City would amount to "sacrificing" the hostages still being held in the Palestinian territory.

title: NDTV Ground Report: The Biggest Rescue Challenge Lies Much Ahead Of Dharali
content: Rescue efforts have entered the fourth day in Dharali, a village ravaged by the recent flash floods in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district.

title: Income Tax Bill 2025 Withdrawn, New Version To Be Introduced On Monday
content: The Income Tax Bill 2025, which was introduced in the Lok Sabha on February 13 to replace the Income Tax Act, 1961, has been formally withdrawn.

title: Uddhav Thackerey, Cousin Raj's Growing Proximity Unnerves Congress
content: The growing proximity between Uddhav Thackeray and his cousin Raj Thackeray has caused considerable unease within the Congress, sparking a fresh round of speculation over the future of Maharashtra's primary opposition alliance, the Maha Vikas Aghadi.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Rahul's Poll Claims: Time To Go Beyond Politics, And Investigate
content: Gandhi must be held accountable - if he is proven wrong - for the allegations he has made. But the EC must also be held accountable if such serious lapses are indeed found.

title: Watch: Talking Parrot Leads To Major Drug Bust In England
content: A talking parrot helped police bust a major gang involved in selling drugs after officers discovered videos of the bird repeating dealer phrases like "two for 25."

title: US India Tariff LIVE Updates: US Economy Shows Signs Of Strain As Trump’s Tariffs Go Into Effect

content: Andy Byron, 50, reportedly spent on subscriptions, custom videos, and "steamy" video calls with multiple OnlyFans creators.

content: India values its relationship with the United States. But friendship must be built on mutual respect, not unilateral demands. We cannot accept a framework where one side dictates terms and the other is expected to comply without question.

title: Air India Plane Crash Victims' Families Hire Firm That Sued Boeing For Lapses
content: A London-bound Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, operating as Air India flight AI171, crashed seconds after taking off from the Ahmedabad airport, killing 260 people.

title: Supreme Court Stays High Court Order Restricting Rape Accused's Wife From Leaving India

title: Two held for pushing man under train at Malakpet railway station
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: How to deal with Trump? Netanyahu says he has advise for PM Modi - will share on one condition
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has offered India assistance in navigating US tariffs, suggesting he'd privately advise PM Modi on dealing with President Trump. He highlighted the effectiveness of Israeli weapons used in Operation Sindoor and expressed willingness to enhance India's surveillance capabilities to combat cross-border terrorism.

title: 'No pause in talks for buying US arms': Centre pans 'false & fabricated' report
content: The defence ministry has refuted reports suggesting India halted defense purchase talks with the US, labeling them as false. This response follows a Reuters report indicating a pause in weapon and aircraft acquisitions due to US tariffs on Indian exports. Despite this, the ministry clarified that procurement cases are progressing as per established procedures.

title: 'Enough is enough': Rahul launches fresh attack on EC; poses 5 questions
content: Rahul Gandhi escalated his accusations against the Election Commission of India (ECI), alleging collusion with the BJP to manipulate voter rolls and ensure Narendra Modi's victory. He presented purported evidence of "fake votes" in Karnataka and questioned the ECI's impartiality, demanding answers regarding missing voter lists, erased CCTV footage, and intimidation of opposition leaders.

title: Sam Altman says ChatGPT 5 is an expert. Small maths slip shows why it’s not perfect
content: OpenAI's GPT-5, hailed as a PhD-level expert, replaces previous models with enhanced reasoning and coding capabilities. Despite improvements in accuracy and reduced hallucinations, it still commits occasional errors, like a basic decimal subtraction mistake. This highlights the importance of clear instructions for optimal performance, even with advanced AI.

title: Virat Kohli's surprise coach revealed ahead of international comeback
content: Virat Kohli has commenced his training regimen in London, gearing up for his anticipated return to one-day international cricket. He was seen practicing his batting skills in an indoor session with Naeem Amin, the assistant coach for Gujarat Titans.

title: 50% tariffs on India: WH adviser calls extra 25% duty 'national security issue'
content: Last week, US President Donald Trump had announced a 25 per cent reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, which came into effect on August 7. On Wednesday, Trump signed an executive order imposing an additional 25 per cent levy, raising the total duties on Indian goods to 50 per cent, which is among the highest placed on any country by the US.

title: Kanhaiya Lal's son brings slain tailor's photo to watch Udaipur Files
content: Following its release after legal clearance, 'Udaipur Files,' a film depicting the Kanhaiya Lal murder case, prompted the slain tailor's son, Yash Sahu, to bring his father's photograph to the theatre. He garlanded the photo and placed it beside him.

title: Startup founder’s wake-up call: 70-hour weeks strained family ties
content: Cache Merrill, founder of Zibtek, initially sacrificed family time for startup success, working relentless hours. A poignant question from his child prompted a shift in perspective, leading him to redefine success to include presence and balance. Merrill then transformed his leadership style, prioritizing well-being and fostering a human-centered workplace at Zibtek.

title: Love gone wild: Indian man faces deportation for harassing UK woman for 6 months
content: Asish Jose Paul, an Indian national, is facing deportation from the UK. He stalked Lutaruta Masiulonyte, his colleague at London Zoo. Paul ignored police warnings and a restraining order. He sent her texts, flowers, and chocolates. The court sentenced him to a suspended prison term and a restraining order. Masiulonyte reported feeling scared and anxious due to his actions.

title: 'AI Mark': British MP becomes available 24/7; bot talks back in his voice
content: Mark Sewards, a British MP, has introduced 'AI Mark'. It is an AI version of himself. This digital assistant addresses public complaints using his voice. The AI aims to offer constituents another way to engage with their MP. It focuses on local casework and policy issues. However, the chatbot has faced criticism.

title: 'Gathering of friendship': China welcomes PM Modi for SCO Tianjin Summit
content: China has extended a warm welcome to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the upcoming Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) Summit in Tianjin, scheduled for August 31 to September 1. This visit marks PM Modi's first trip to China since the 2020 Galwan Valley clash. The summit aims to foster regional security, economic cooperation, and address geopolitical issues among member states.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman at GPT-5 launch: India is our second-largest market
content: OpenAI has launched GPT-5, its most advanced AI model, boasting significant improvements in accuracy, speed, and reasoning. CEO Sam Altman highlighted India as a rapidly growing market, potentially surpassing the US. GPT-5 is available in various sizes and tiers, including a free version, with enhanced versions for Team, Enterprise, Edu, and Pro users, marking a step towards Artificial General Intelligence.

title: Ground invasion in Gaza? Israel military building up troops, equipment near border
content: Commercial satellite images indicate a significant buildup of Israeli troops and equipment along the Gaza border, potentially signaling preparations for a new ground assault. This follows the Israeli security cabinet's approval of a plan to take control of Gaza City, a move short of a full occupation.

title: Navratilova once shared how her tennis image was shaped by rival Evert’s upbringing
content: Martina Navratilova's comments sparked renewed interest in Chris Evert. Navratilova suggested Evert's strict Catholic upbringing shaped her public image. She contrasted this with her own experiences growing up in Czechoslovakia. Navratilova noted Evert's desire to please her parents influenced her behavior. The remarks added a new layer to their famous rivalry. Their contrasting styles fueled tennis's growth.

title: Asia Cup: Is India vs Pakistan under threat? UAE cricket board's COO provides clarity
content: Cricket fans anticipate India and Pakistan clash in Asia Cup 2025. Emirates Cricket Board assures the high-voltage match will likely happen. The tournament is scheduled from September 9 to 28 in Dubai and Abu Dhabi. India will face Pakistan on September 14 at Dubai International Cricket Stadium. There are chances of further encounters in Super 4s and the final.

title: 'Took oath inside Parliament': Rahul Gandhi responds to EC's 'sign affidavit' dare
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi intensified his "vote theft" allegations at a Bengaluru rally, demanding the Election Commission (EC) provide the complete electronic voter list and video records. He claimed some state election websites were taken down after Congress's expose. Gandhi warned EC officials of consequences, accusing them of attacking the constitution.

title: India’s 3rd launch pad In Sriharikota only by March 2029
content: India's space program is set for a boost with a third launch pad at Sriharikota, slated for completion by March 2029. This facility will primarily support the Next Generation Launch Vehicle (NGLV) and act as a backup for heavy-lift vehicles. The project emphasizes collaboration with Indian private players and MSMEs, aligning with the nation's self-reliance goals.

title: Torrential rains wreak havoc in China: 10 dead, 33 missing; Xi calls for rescue push
content: Flash floods in China's Gansu province caused immense destruction. Ten people died, and 33 remain missing. Continuous heavy rainfall triggered the disaster. President Xi Jinping urged utmost rescue efforts. Emergency teams are searching for the missing. The meteorological department warned of continued rainfall. Gansu is prone to floods during the monsoon season. The disaster follows recent heavy rainfall in Beijing.

title: New Income-Tax Bill: Why Centre withdrew legislation from Lok Sabha
content: The Income-Tax Bill, 2025, initially introduced in February, has been withdrawn by the government to prevent confusion. A revised version, incorporating recommendations from the Select Committee led by BJP MP Baijayant Panda, is set to be presented in the Lok Sabha on August 11.

title: 754 runs not enough? 'Jadeja 'more consistent' than Shubman Gill'
content: Ajay Jadeja lauded Ravindra Jadeja's remarkable all-round display in England, highlighting his consistency with both bat and ball. Despite Shubman Gill's impressive 754 runs, Ajay emphasized Ravindra's crucial contributions, particularly his resilience in pressure situations. His performances at Lord's and throughout the series showcased his fortitude, making him a standout performer in the drawn series.

title: Humanitarian aid: Trump 'began yelling' at Netanyahu on phone over Gaza starvation
content: A heated phone exchange occurred between Benjamin Netanyahu and Donald Trump over Gaza's humanitarian crisis, as reported by NBC News. Trump contradicted Netanyahu's denial of starvation in Gaza, citing images of hungry children. Netanyahu insisted reports were fabricated by Hamas, but Trump asserted he had seen proof of starvation.

title: Priyanka Gandhi slams Election Commission; backs Rahul's claims of voter fraud
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has criticized the Election Commission, urging an investigation into Rahul Gandhi's allegations of widespread voter fraud. She questioned the EC's impartiality, suggesting a bias towards the BJP and accusing the poll body of ignoring evidence while focusing on procedural demands. The EC defends its stance, requiring a formal declaration from Rahul Gandhi before initiating any action.

title: Triple H on the cricket field? Umpire's WWE-inspired act goes viral - WATCH
content: Billy Bowden's unique umpiring entertained cricket fans. His iconic gestures are fondly remembered. A recent video shows an umpire imitating WWE star Triple H while signaling a wide. The act is bringing back memories of Bowden. Bowden officiated many matches. He stood in men's and women's cricket games. His career spanned over two decades. The video has gone viral online.

title: These 15 science facts are so bizarre, you'll think we're lying (but we're not)
content: Science reveals bizarre truths. Bananas are slightly radioactive. Stomachs digest themselves. Earth has more trees than stars. A teaspoon of neutron star weighs billions of tons. One can survive briefly in space without a suit. Wombat poop is cube-shaped. Octopuses possess multiple hearts and brains. Even spiders have journeyed to space.

title: Elon Musk updates Mars mission timeline: Starship crewed by Optimus possible in 2026; real target now 2028–2030
content: Elon Musk has adjusted SpaceX's Mars mission timeline, pushing back the potential Starship launch to 2028 for an uncrewed flight and 2030 for a crewed mission. Technical challenges, including Starship failures and delays in mastering in-space propellant refuelling, have contributed to this shift.

title: Good enough for K'taka govt: EC takes jab at Rahul's vote theft claim
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) refuted Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's claims of voter list manipulation, highlighting that the Karnataka government, led by Congress, utilizes the same electoral rolls for its caste census. ECI sources pointed out the contradiction, noting Rahul Gandhi's allegations coincided with the state government's reliance on the rolls.

title: Watch: Denied entry for Indian attire? Eatery apologises; Delhi CM orders probe
content: A Delhi couple was allegedly denied entry to a Pitampura restaurant because the woman was wearing Indian clothes, sparking outrage after a video of the incident went viral. Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta intervened, ordering an investigation and swift action. The restaurant has since apologised, rescinding dress restrictions and offering discounts to women in Indian attire for Rakshabandhan.

title: Happy Raksha Bandhan: Images, quotes, wishes, messages, cards, greetings card, pictures
content: Raksha Bandhan, a Hindu festival, celebrates the bond between siblings. Sisters tie Rakhi on their brother's wrist. This signifies love and protection. The article provides messages, quotes, and wishes for Raksha Bandhan 2025. It includes images and GIFs for the festival. The content focuses on expressing love and strengthening sibling relationships. It shares greetings for a joyous celebration.

title: 'It was like hills were chasing us': Friends who dodged death in Uttarkashi
content: A flash flood in Dharali, Uttarkashi, triggered by the Kheer Gad stream, has left a trail of destruction. Sohan Singh Panwar, a hotel worker, recounts the terrifying moment when the Shiwalik Hotel collapsed, prompting frantic screams and a desperate escape.

title: Selena Gomez opens up abs Taylor Swift reportedly end all ties with Blake Lively
content: Amidst personal changes, Taylor Swift's friendship with Blake Lively reportedly ended due to legal issues involving Justin Baldoni. Selena Gomez discussed her long-standing bond with Swift, revealing their shared history of dating Jonas Brothers. Swift and Kelce are expected at Gomez's wedding. Swift has been seen reconnecting with Gomez, while distancing herself from Lively and Ryan Reynolds.

title: Trump tariffs: How much will India’s fuel bill rise if Russian oil is cut off?
content: India faces a potential $9-12 billion increase in crude oil import expenses if it halts Russian oil purchases due to potential tariffs. While India has diversified its oil sources, Russian oil accounts for a significant portion of its imports. Trump's tariffs aim to pressure Russia over the Ukraine war, creating a complex situation for India's energy security and trade relations.

title: 'Lost 53 hours and 21 minutes': Kiren Rijiju on Parliament logjam
content: Kiren Rijiju expressed concern about Rajya Sabha disruptions. He urged MPs to follow a 1997 resolution for smooth functioning. The Upper House lost 53 hours of work. Despite protests, the Rajya Sabha passed the Coastal Shipping Bill, 2025. The opposition protested the Bihar Special Intense Revision. The government rejected discussion demands, citing constitutional provisions and a sub judice matter.

title: Bengaluru: Girl shares private videos with friend, clips surface on 23 porn sites
content: A Bengaluru student, Clara, faced immense distress after private videos shared with a friend, Anoop, surfaced online, including pornographic websites. She filed a police complaint after the videos reappeared despite initial takedown requests. An Instagram user, Rony Ronel, then demanded money to remove the videos, threatening further distribution.

title: Stunt on Thar roof lands woman, driver in trouble; FIR filed
content: Gurgaon police have registered a case against a woman and a male driver for performing a dangerous stunt on the Delhi-Jaipur highway. The woman was filmed sitting on the roof of a moving Mahindra Thar, prompting criticism after the video circulated on social media. Authorities filed charges at DLF Sector 29 police station, citing endangerment to themselves and others.

title: 'Why just Air India?': SC rejects plea seeking safety audit after AI171 crash
content: The Supreme Court declined to hear a PIL seeking an independent safety audit of Air India following a fatal crash on June 12 involving a Boeing 787 Dreamliner. The court questioned the petition's focus solely on Air India, suggesting the petitioner approach the DGCA or Union government with broader safety concerns applicable to all airlines.

title: Wink at 9-year-old: Mumbai court acquits 71-year-old with eye surgeries in Pocso case
content: A special POCSO court acquitted a 78-year-old man of sexual abuse and harassment charges, citing his age, physical limitations from surgeries and leg rods, and inconsistencies in the nine-year-old complainant's testimony. The judge questioned the lack of corroborating witnesses or evidence from other building residents regarding the alleged incidents.

title: Pundit suggests CSK sign Samson as Dhoni replacement by releasing Ashwin
content: Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals captain, may leave after the 2025 IPL season. He has reportedly told the franchise about exploring options. Aakash Chopra suggests Kolkata Knight Riders could be a good fit. Chopra cites KKR's need for an Indian wicketkeeper-batter. He also mentions concerns about Ajinkya Rahane's batting. Changes in Rajasthan Royals' strategy may have influenced Samson's decision.

title: Huma Qureshi's cousin murdered: Chilling visuals from crime scene emerge
content: Asif Qureshi, relative of Bollywood actor Huma Qureshi, was murdered in Delhi. The incident occurred after a parking dispute in Jangpura’s Bhogal Bazar Lane. CCTV footage showed a heated argument escalating into a physical attack. Two brothers, Gautam and Ujjwal, have been arrested. Ujjwal initiated the attack. Police have registered a murder case. Investigation is currently underway.

title: 'Only Tamil and English to continue': Stalin rolls out new education policy for TN
content: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin has unveiled the state's new education policy, crafted in response to the Centre's National Education Policy (NEP). The state government strongly opposes the NEP, viewing it as a Hindi imposition and against social justice.

title: IND vs ENG | On-field shenanigans kept the series dramatic - here's why
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy between India and England emerged as an era-defining rivalry, marked by record-breaking performances and intense confrontations. Shubman Gill's captaincy and England's 'Bazball' approach set the stage for a heated series filled with on-field clashes and emotional spikes. Despite the drama and verbal exchanges, moments of respect and sportsmanship highlighted the enduring appeal of Test cricket.

title: 'Sign declaration or apologise': EC counters Rahul over 'vote chori' claim
content: The Election Commission confronts Rahul Gandhi over electoral fraud claims. They demand he signs a declaration supporting his allegations. Alternatively, the commission wants an apology. Gandhi alleges vote manipulation in Karnataka. He accuses the EC of colluding with the BJP. The EC denies destroying evidence. They state Gandhi failed to respond to earlier requests for proof.

title: Cricket: Kohli’s 2018 masterclass vs England still outshines Gill’s run-fest in 2025
content: Shubman Gill's stellar performance in the drawn Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy has sparked comparisons with Virat Kohli's 2018 tour. Gill amassed 754 runs, surpassing Kohli's series total, but Kohli's innings was played in tougher conditions. While Gill's series was exceptional, Kohli's resilience in 2018 remains a testament to his fighting spirit.

title: With Trump’s 50% tariffs looming, India reviews market access offer to US
content: Despite increased US tariffs on crude oil trade with Russia, India is reassessing its market access offers to the US, aiming to finalize a trade deal this month. While committed to protecting its agricultural and dairy sectors, India is exploring improvements in other areas.

title: The curious case of India’s teacher shortage and rising literacy
content: India’s literacy rate is rising, but a severe teacher shortage threatens future gains. States like Bihar, Punjab, Karnataka, and Rajasthan face tens of thousands of vacancies, with many schools staffed by only one or two teachers. Budget cuts, slow recruitment, and unattractive working conditions fuel the crisis, risking ‘functional illiteracy’ despite glowing literacy statistics.

title: U.S.'s Shelton rallies to win Toronto final in three sets
content: Ben Shelton wins the national bank open for the third and biggest title of his young career . shelton beats 11th-seeded Karen Khachanov of Russia 6-7 (5), 6-4, 7-6 (3) . the 22-year-old becomes the first american to win any Masters 1000 title since 2003 .

content: the 2025 preseason kicks off with several rookies playing their first snaps . a play from Jalen Milroe 's debut showed exactly how he can help the Seahawks' offense this season even as their third QB .

title: Power Rankings: Who's the best team in baseball right now?
content: the Phillies sit at no. 1 for the third consecutive week . the Yankees have dropped five straight games since July 31 . they have fallen to their lowest ranking of the season at No. 12 . but the red sox have won seven of their last eight games .

title: It has never been tougher to build an NBA dynasty: 'You literally can't mess anything up'
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . since the Warriors won back-to-back titles in 2017 and 2018, the NBA has seen seven different champions hoist the Larry O'Brien Trophy . there have been 11 different finalists in each of the past six postseasons .

title: PPR rankings: Top 100 for 2025
content: field Yates' 2025 fantasy football rankings will be updated throughout the preseason to reflect any changes in his view on players for the upcoming season . the rankings below are for PPR formats . he explains how Stefon Diggs could bounce back and put up big numbers in fantasy .

title: 🐔 'Scottie's Chicken Shack' debuts at FedEx Cup
content: "Scottie's Chicken Shack" is a nod to the four-time major winner's role in "Happy Gilmore 2" the movie is released on Netflix on July 25 . the film features a photo op of Scheffler punching the team-max golfer .

title: Explaining MLS' discovery rights: What were Müller's extra steps to Vancouver?
content: MLS commissioner don Garber speaks about the potential change to the league's schedule after the 2026 FIFA World Cup . atypical but significant mechanism in MLS's single-entity structure called the Discovery List . the regulation allows teams to "discover" and select up to five non-MLS players .

title: Why new RBs coach Tashard Choice fits in Detroit
content: quarterback Tashard Choice is on the practice field in his first season on the Lions' coaching staff . "it means a lot. We've been close since I was 16 or 17 now," Gibbs says . he says he's a 'familiar face' and 'we just ended up together' "it's really great having a familiar face," he adds .

title: Community Shield will tell us whether Liverpool are the team to beat
content: arne slot has assembled "a really strong" squad going into the new season . the champions' 2025-26 campaign begins in earnest at home to Bournemouth on august 15 . it is a tradition that dates back more than a century .
